alert.note: Alert for Boone; Logan; Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 12:46AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mingo, western Logan and west central Boone Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 1246 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Mount Gay-Shamrock, or 10 miles west of Logan, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Logan, Chapmanville, Man, Chief Logan State, Holden, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Mallory, West Logan, Mitchell Heights, Mount Gay, Verdunville, Chauncey, Switzer, Dingess, Lenore, Breeden and Bruno. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 13 and 38, and between mile markers 41 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
